alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 4:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Central Lincoln County in southern Nevada. * WHEN...Until 700 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Radar indicates that between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen, with additional rainfall expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alamo, US Highway 93 between mile markers 23 and 44, Pahranagat West Road, Box Canyon Road, and Repeater Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
